title: MS ClearType fonts on Mac
content:
So am I correct that the only way to get a CT  
font to work on OSX is to buy it from Ascender?

hhp
author: hrant

comments.content: IIRC theyâ€™re all bundled with the latest MS Office for Mac.

Good news. Is MS Office something a Mac user would generally have to pay for, or does it come free/bundled with something-or-other? Also, do the fonts perhaps come with other MS apps for OSX, like Word?

hhp

For those with Office 2008 for Mac, or Vista installed on their Mac:  
 [bundled with the software](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530194238/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/pr/pr2008_04_17.html)

For those with Office 2004 for Mac:  
 [bundled with an optional Open XML Converter download](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530194238/http:/www.labnol.org/software/tutorials/free-download-calibri-font-on-mac/3684/).

For those without Office, but with a pre-Vista Windows system installed on their Mac:  
 [Available via the Powerpoint 2007 Viewer or the Microsoft Office Compatibility pack](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530194238/http:/labnol.blogspot.com/2007/03/download-windows-vista-fonts-legally.html).

For those who have neither Office nor a Windows version:  
 [the CT fonts can be purchased via Ascender](http://web.archive.org/web/20110530194238/http:/www.ascendercorp.com/ctfonts.html)
